result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason E. Miller

records.addlTxt: Atty Southworth waives reading of the Information.  DE advised of charges and penalties.  Atty Southworth stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea.

1:43 PM Defendant Jason E. Miller in court.  Attorney Scott Harold Southworth in court for Jason E. Miller.  Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  DE advised right to a preliminary hearing.  Atty Southworth is satisfied with DE's waiver.  Atty Southworth did thoroughly go through the wavier form with DE.  Court finds DE competent and finds waiver to be free, knowing and voluntary.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1.
Return date scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Return date on November 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
10:34 AM Defendant Jason E. Miller in court.  Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  State doesn't object to reset if DE wants atty.  DE hasn't done anything since July, friend stated needed a State ID to get atty. Court reviews financial information.  Court finds conditionally indigent.   Court appoints Attorney Sctot Southworth @$100/hr and reimbursement @ $50.00/month commencing 9/16/22.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on September 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:42 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess and intern Dan Moon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jason E. Miller appeared by video, in custody from LEC w/atty. Dolch.  DE does not qualify for PD representation.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $500.00 Signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute Sobriety;  Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 1, 2022 at 10:45 am.

9:32 AM Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin and Dep. B. Trager.  Defendant Jason E. Miller not in court.  State requests a warrant. 
 Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.
Absolute Sobriety from alcohol & controlled substances unless with a valid Rx

2:51 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jason E. Miller appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Annie E Getsinger appeared by video for Jason E. Miller. Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  DE does not qualify for public defender representation.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  State does not object to a signature bond.  No objection from Atty Getsinger.  $500.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances unless with a valid Rx.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 7, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
